Settlement in Northern Mariana Islands
Capitol Hill
Settlement
Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands Legislature Building at Capitol Hill
Territory Northern Mariana Islands
Area
 • Total 1.48 sq mi (3.8 km2)
Population (2010)
 • Total 1,028[1]
Website www.gov.mp

Capitol Hill[2][3][4] (sometimes spelled Capital Hill,[5] formerly Army Hill under the United States Navy,[6]) is a settlement (sometimes termed a village or district) on the island of Saipan in the Northern Mariana Islands. It has a population of just over 1,000.[1] Capitol Hill has been the territory's seat of government since 1962. It lies on the cross-island road between Tanapag and San Vicente.

Capitol Hill was originally built in 1948 by the Central Intelligence Agency as a base involved in covert training of Nationalist Chinese guerrillas.[7]

The area is home to various government departments and agencies:

  • Governor's Office
  • Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands Legislature Building
  • US Post Office
  • Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands Department of Commerce
  • Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands Workforce Investment Agency
  • Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands Council for Arts and Culture

Transportation[edit]

Route 31 (Cross Island Road) or Isa Drive is the main road in the area.
